Young Adult

Reviews, recommendations, posts and ideas for and by young adults.

Pick up an amazing graphic novel from the 2018 Excelsior Award shortlist

Written by Sophie Green · Published Mar 22, 2018

The Excelsior Award highlights the best graphic novels published each year across genre and style. The winners are decided by pupils at participating secondary schools across the UK.

Undercover Princess by Connie Glynn

Written by Am√©lie Magotte · Published Mar 20, 2018

Undercover Princess will appeal to anyone who loves drama, humour and wild characters doing wild things.

The Last Days of Archie Maxwell by Annabel Pitcher

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Mar 15, 2018

The Last Days of Archie Maxwell is a powerful and poignant contemporary that discusses important, hard-hitting issues.

Celebrate International Women's Day with these top YA picks

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Mar 8, 2018

To mark International Women's Day, library volunteer Emily is celebrating the best female characters in YA.

Blackbird by N. D. Gomes

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Mar 8, 2018

Blackbird is tense, well-plotted and addictive.

Pick up a stellar title from the YA Book Prize shortlist

Written by Alice Violett · Published Mar 2, 2018

The shortlist for The YA Book Prize was announced on Friday 1 March. This award "celebrates great books for teenagers and young adults and aims to get more teens reading."

Amy Chelsea Stacie Dee by Mary G. Thompson

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Mar 1, 2018

Amy Chelsea Stacie Dee is a riveting, unputdownable book.

New Young Adult books for March 2018

Written by Sophie Green · Published Feb 28, 2018

This month's list has something for everyone, from modern fantasy to gripping sci-fi to gritty realism.

The White Hare by Michael Fishwick

Written by Emma Maguire · Published Feb 27, 2018

The White Hare is a coming-of-age novel that will especially appeal to fans of myth and folklore

My Side of the Diamond by Sally Gardener

Written by Am√©lie Magotte · Published Feb 22, 2018

My Side of the Diamond is really exciting and amazingly realistic.

About our Young Adult section

Book reviews, reading suggestions and blog posts from our staff and young adult readers. Want to write for our website? Email us at help@suffolklibraries.co.uk.
